p: It is argued by Worobey et al. that the propensity of initial influenza virus exposure to establish a lifelong immunological imprint also presents a remarkable opportunity: immunization of infants prior to their initial, natural virus exposure with multiple versions of common human subtypes simultaneously may promise extended immunological imprinting across all currently circulating strains and against potential pandemic strains of IAV. This approach might be a possible step toward a universal vaccine (Cohen 2018; Worobey et al. 2020).
